Creating a Barplot

# Load the ggplot2 library library(ggplot2) # Create a barplot using mtcars dataset # Display the number of cars by the number of cylinders (cyl) data(mtcars) # Load the ggplot2 library library(ggplot2) # Create a barplot using mtcars dataset ggplot(mtcars, aes(factor(cyl))) + geom_bar() + labs(title = "Number of Cars by Cylinder", x = "Cylinders", y = "Count") test_function("ggplot", args = c("data", "mapping")) test_function("geom_bar") test_function("labs") success_msg("Great job creating a barplot!")
Use `ggplot(data = mtcars, aes(factor(cyl))) + geom_bar()` to create the barplot.

Creating a Histogram

# Load the ggplot2 library library(ggplot2) # Create a histogram of the distribution of miles per gallon (mpg) data(mtcars) # Load the ggplot2 library library(ggplot2) # Create a histogram of the distribution of miles per gallon (mpg) ggplot(mtcars, aes(mpg)) + geom_histogram(bins = 10, fill = "blue") + labs(title = "Distribution of Miles Per Gallon", x = "Miles Per Gallon", y = "Frequency") test_function("ggplot", args = c("data", "mapping")) test_function("geom_histogram") test_function("labs") success_msg("Well done on creating a histogram!")
Use `ggplot(data = mtcars, aes(mpg)) + geom_histogram(bins = 10)` to create the histogram.

Creating a Scatter Plot

# Load the ggplot2 library library(ggplot2) # Create a scatter plot for weight (wt) against miles per gallon (mpg) data(mtcars) # Load the ggplot2 library library(ggplot2) # Create a scatter plot for weight (wt) against miles per gallon (mpg) ggplot(mtcars, aes(x = wt, y = mpg)) + geom_point(color = "red") + labs(title = "Weight vs. Miles Per Gallon", x = "Weight (1000 lbs)", y = "Miles Per Gallon") test_function("ggplot", args = c("data", "mapping")) test_function("geom_point") test_function("labs") success_msg("Excellent work on creating a scatter plot!")
Use `ggplot(data = mtcars, aes(x = wt, y = mpg)) + geom_point()` to create the scatter plot.
